# ssmpower: Power Analysis for the Structural Summary Method

## Overview

**ssmpower** provides power analysis and sample size planning for
Structural Summary Method (SSM) analyses of circumplex data. It
implements the methods described in:

> Gilbert, K. J. (2026). Power analysis for the Structural Summary
> Method. *Manuscript in preparation.*

## Installation

``` r
# Install from GitHub (current version)
devtools::install_github("kimberlyjg/ssmpower")

# Or from CRAN (after acceptance)
# install.packages("ssmpower")
```

## Quick Start

``` r
library(ssmpower)

# How many participants do I need?
ssm_sample_size_amplitude(effect = 0.16, power = 0.80)
#> n = 41 for 80% power

# What's my power with N = 100?
ssm_power_amplitude(effect = 0.16, n = 100)
#> Power = 0.95

# Print a quick reference guide
ssm_sample_size_guide()

# Launch the interactive web app
run_app()
```

## Interactive Web App

Don‚Äôt want to install R? Use the **free online calculator**:

üåê **<https://kjgilbert01.shinyapps.io/shiny/>**

## Effect Size Benchmarks

Based on Zimmermann & Wright (2017):

| Parameter | Small | Medium | Large |
|-----------|-------|--------|-------|
| Amplitude | 0.10  | 0.16   | 0.23  |
| Elevation | 0.02  | 0.11   | 0.27  |

## Sample Sizes for 80% Power

| Design                 | Parameter | Small | Medium | Large |
|------------------------|-----------|-------|--------|-------|
| Single sample          | Amplitude | 104   | 41     | 20    |
| Single sample          | Elevation | 7064  | 234    | 39    |
| Two groups (per group) | Amplitude | 264   | 104    | 50    |

## Main Functions

| Function | Purpose |
|----|----|
| [`ssm_power_amplitude()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_amplitude.md) | Calculate power for amplitude tests |
| [`ssm_power_elevation()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_elevation.md) | Calculate power for elevation tests |
| [`ssm_sample_size_amplitude()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_amplitude.md) | Determine N for amplitude tests |
| [`ssm_sample_size_elevation()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_elevation.md) | Determine N for elevation tests |
| [`ssm_power_amplitude_diff()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_amplitude_diff.md) | Power for two-group amplitude comparisons |
| [`ssm_sample_size_amplitude_diff()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_amplitude_diff.md) | Sample size for two-group comparisons |
| [`ssm_analyze()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_analyze.md) | Full SSM analysis with bootstrap CIs |
| [`ssm_sample_size_guide()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_guide.md) | Print quick reference table |
| [`run_app()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/run_app.md) | Launch interactive Shiny calculator |

## Citation

If you use this package, please cite:

    Gilbert, K. J. (2026). Power analysis for the Structural Summary Method.
    Manuscript in preparation.

    Gilbert, K. J. (2026). ssmpower: Power Analysis for the Structural Summary
    Method. R package version 1.0.0. https://github.com/kimberlyjg/ssmpower

## References

- Zimmermann, J., & Wright, A. G. C. (2017). Beyond description in
  interpersonal construct validation. *Assessment, 24*, 3-23.
- Wright, A. G. C., Pincus, A. L., Conroy, D. E., & Hilsenroth, M. J.
  (2009). Integrating methods to optimize circumplex description.
  *Assessment, 16*, 212-224.

MIT

# Package index

## Package

- [`ssmpower-package`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssmpower-package.md)
  [`ssmpower`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssmpower-package.md)
  : ssmpower: Power Analysis for the Structural Summary Method

## Power Analysis

Calculate statistical power for SSM parameters

- [`ssm_power_amplitude()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_amplitude.md)
  : Power for Single-Sample Amplitude Test
- [`ssm_power_elevation()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_elevation.md)
  : Power for Single-Sample Elevation Test
- [`ssm_power_amplitude_diff()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_amplitude_diff.md)
  : Power for Two-Group Amplitude Difference
- [`ssm_power_elevation_diff()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_elevation_diff.md)
  : Power for Two-Group Elevation Difference
- [`ssm_power_table()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_power_table.md)
  : Generate Power Table

## Sample Size Planning

Determine required sample sizes

- [`ssm_sample_size_amplitude()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_amplitude.md)
  : Required Sample Size for Amplitude Test
- [`ssm_sample_size_elevation()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_elevation.md)
  : Required Sample Size for Elevation Test
- [`ssm_sample_size_amplitude_diff()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_amplitude_diff.md)
  : Required Sample Size for Two-Group Amplitude Comparison
- [`ssm_sample_size_elevation_diff()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_elevation_diff.md)
  : Required Sample Size for Two-Group Elevation Comparison
- [`ssm_sample_size_guide()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_sample_size_guide.md)
  : Print Sample Size Quick Reference Guide

## SSM Analysis

Compute SSM parameters from data

- [`ssm_analyze()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_analyze.md)
  : Comprehensive SSM Analysis with Bootstrap CIs and Power
- [`ssm_parameters()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_parameters.md)
  : Calculate SSM Parameters from Octant Scores

## Utilities

Helper functions

- [`ssm_ci_amplitude()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_ci_amplitude.md)
  : Confidence Interval for Amplitude
- [`ssm_ci_elevation()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_ci_elevation.md)
  : Confidence Interval for Elevation
- [`ssm_effect_label()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/ssm_effect_label.md)
  : Effect Size Label
- [`run_app()`](https://kimberlyjg.github.io/ssmpower/reference/run_app.md)
  : Launch the SSM Power Analysis Shiny App
